rows.title: Relationship vacuum
rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ Every human being needs positive relationships whether children, men and women.
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ Life hates a relationship vacuum. When there is a relationship vacuum with one's family, they feel empty both inside and around them.
rows.text_3: ðŸ’¡ But because life hates a relationship vacuum, we are naturally drawn to fill that gap.
rows.text_4: ðŸ’¡ This vacuum often leads us to turn to other people or things such as drugs, alcohol consumption, or establish other relationships with other people in order to fill the existing gap.

rows.title: Raising a child
rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ It is a good thing to raise a child and a child is a PERSON like you and me.
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ Everyone may see a child differently depending on the circumstance surrounding their family or community.
rows.text_3: ðŸ’¡ Treating children negatively because of 'bad' behaviour can only worsen the situation.
rows.text_4: ðŸ’¡ As caregivers, we need to pay attention to the needs of our children. It is important to try and live like you have '3 months' left in order to raise children whose behaviour earns the family respect.

rows.title: Needs of children in different developmental stages
rows.intro_text: Here are a few suggestions on how you can ensure your child grows in specific developmental stages:
rows.text_1:
* Proper nutrition
* Shelter
* Play 
* Protection from violence
rows.text_2:
* Simulation
* Colorful pictures
* Education
* Interactive play
* Good nutrition
* Time for rest
rows.text_3:
* Supportive family
* Love
* Feeling secure
* Protection from neglect and emotional abuse
rows.text_4:
* Positive role models
* Positive and consistent discipline in a loving context (praising good behavior, explaining why bad behavior is wrong, giving positive remarks by name).

rows.title: Following child's needs
rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ Play promotes every aspect of children's development - physical, social, emotional and cognitive
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ When children play, learning occurs that we do not realize. leaning in play is integrated, powerful, and largely invisible to the untrained eye. much of this learning happens without direct teaching.
rows.text_3: ðŸ’¡ This learning has a central value in childhood and long-term development benefits.

rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ As caregivers and parents, we need to be intentional while parenting to continue with the postive experiences we experineced in our childhood and drop the negative experiences. This will not only improve our parent - child bond also support us enjoy parenting
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ Parents/caregivers have a deep and long-lasting impact on their childrenâ€™s lives. For example, even as adults, we can still â€˜hearâ€™ our parentâ€™s voices or â€˜seeâ€™ their actions in our lives (legacy).
rows.text_3: ðŸ’¡ Parents/caretakers can have the greatest impact by teaching their child/ren about different life issues. As a parent,it is important to reflect on how you want your child/children to remember you.
rows.title: Tips
Tips on Father's support during pregnancy
rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ When a woman is pregnant she has changes in her body which often affects her emotionally and physically.
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ Partners should be sensitive, objective, and realistic about issues that bring conflicts.
rows.text_3: ðŸ’¡ Men must participate actively for their families especially during and after pregnancy for the wellbeing of the mother and the baby.

rows.title: Tips on how to Set Limits for our children
rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ Too many limits prevent children from learning on their own. Set limits on things that are important for the family
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ Rules should be consistent and should not change every day and when there is more than one caregiver in a home.
rows.text_3: ðŸ’¡ Limits should be stated positively and appropriate to childrenâ€™s age and  abilities
rows.text_4: ðŸ’¡ Limits should be clear, easy to understand and connected to a specific behavior.

rows.title: Tips for parenting for positive relationships and respectability
rows.intro_text: Exerting power to achieve what you demand from the child may bring about conflict.
rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ In everyday life, many parents tend to draw from different parenting styles but as a parent, it is important that you reflect on your dominant style and choose one that promotes the bond and attachment.
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ Children, especially teenagers, learn to solve problems and plan with the possible consequences in mind.
rows.text_3: ðŸ’¡ Respect from children can best be attained by having interactive relationships, laying down clear rules of behavior, and holding your children accountable for their actions/behavior.
rows.text_4: ðŸ’¡ The authoritative/firm style is generally considered the best because it promotes bonding and attachment between parents and their children while ensuring proper discipline of children

rows.title: Key highlights on norms, practices and behaviour
rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ As you have seen gender refers to the social attributes and opportunities associated with being male and female, the relationships between women and men and girls and boys. These attributes, opportunies and relationships are socially constructed and learned through the socialization processes.
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ We also need to learn the attributes in the opposite sex's boxes that are positive. However, care should be taken not to use this as an opportunity to exploit others for instance a man should continue fulfilling their responsibilities even when they learn to practice the positive things from the woman's box.
rows.text_3: ðŸ’¡ Abuse of power can make individuals vulnerable to gender based violence and mistreatment, and this negatively affect family relationships
rows.text_4: ðŸ’¡ Men and women can choose to build a culture of respect in their families by using their leadership role to love, support and advise their wives and children.This can benefit them because they gain more respect at home and in thecommunity.

rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ Overcoming challenges in marriage can be difficult but the ingredients for a healthy marriage can be learned. If you are interested and motivated, a healthy marriage can be built for the benefit of the husband, wife, and children.
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ To build supportive relationships, it is important to focus on our spouse's strengths rather than their weaknesses. Just like the way children help one another during playtime, spouses need to find opportunities to support each other with a good attitude.
rows.title: Tips

rows.intro_text: Men can do many simple things to help redefine their role and build their skills in childcare, including:
rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ Spending time talking about each family memberâ€™s needs and roles
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ Working together with mothers â€“ everybody benefits when parents work together to maintain the home
rows.text_3: ðŸ’¡ Taking responsibility. This involves noticing what needs doing, and planning when and how it gets done.
rows.text_4: ðŸ’¡ Planning to spend time alone with their children. This helps to forge strong bonds and warm relations with children, understand childrenâ€™s needs and develop parenting skills.
rows.text_5: ðŸ’¡ Parents, including fathers who are more involved enjoy more positive relations with their children.
rows.title: Tips

rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ In marriage, its important for partners to appreciate the meaning of openness and transparency
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ Partners should commit to making change in own behaviour first, rather than trying hard to change their spouse.
rows.text_3:
ðŸ’¡ We invest in building more trust and loyalty to oneâ€™s partner.
We need to try and always focus on your spouseâ€™s strengths rather than their weaknesses, and this should be a key aspect in marriage.
rows.text_4: ðŸ’¡ Your goal in the bedroom should be to fulfil your spouseâ€™s sexual needs and your own needs.
rows.text_5: ðŸ’¡ In our intimate relationships, you should never use sex to manipulate and/or punish your spouse.
rows.text_6: ðŸ’¡ As married people, we need to understand each other properly. Know when to give positive and negative feedback but do that with patience and in love.
rows.title: Tips

rows.intro_text:
Parents and children often tend to see things from different of view and this mainly because there have different expectations and experiences and desire for different things in life.    

Sun Tzu wrote: If you know your enemy and know yourself, you need not fear the result of a hundred battles. If you know yourself and not your enemy, for every victory, you will also suffer defeat. If you know neither, you will succumb in every battle.        

As a parent, I always have the attitude of â€˜I am going to run the race and win it no matter the inconvenience and the price.â€™ These are some of the ways:
rows.text_1:
* Accept the child unconditionally
* Show care and concern while balancing love with discipline
rows.text_2:
* Show that the child is important, matters to you and donâ€™t give up
* Communicate with your Child
rows.text_3:
* Talk with, not at or down to (make time to converse)
* Be approachable and engage emotionally
rows.text_4:
* The child learns to tell lies, cheat or blame others to avoid being hit.
* Children tend to have strong feelings of anger, hurt, and injustice and may hate themselves.* Listen, listen, listen
* Equip your child with values based Software for life (fruit of the Spirit)
* Love the mother/ father of your child
rows.text_5: * Beating children can encourage them to bully others, misleading them to think that it is okay to hit others when you are bigger and stronger, due to anger or to get what you want. This eventually leads to being violent in adult life.
rows.text_6:
* The child becomes withdrawn, fears parents/adults, feels less valued, anxious or depressed.
* A child can break trust and respect for adults.
rows.outro_text: ðŸ’¡ A positive approach to discipline is less stressful for children and strengthens the bond with the parents. It takes patience but is worth it in the long run.
rows.title: Tips

rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ Every parent wants their child to become a successful, caring adult, thus taking them to school
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ Children who are actively and truly supported by parents in their education tend to do better in school.
rows.text_3: ðŸ’¡ A non-school-going girl is more likely to get married early and get unintended pregnancies among others than a school-going girl.
rows.text_4: ðŸ’¡ An educated woman is more likely to contribute to her family income and get involved in her childrenâ€™s learning and social life than a mother with no schooling.
rows.text_5: ðŸ’¡ How parents perceive the purpose of education affects choices of schools for their children. what they provide for children while in school, how they allocate time for household chores for their children, study and play among others.
rows.title: Tips

rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ As parents, we are the first and lifetime teachers of our children.
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ How parents perceive the purpose of education affects choices of schools for their children. What they provide for children while in school, how they allocate time for household chores for their children, study and play among others.
rows.text_3: ðŸ’¡ If parents believe the purpose is to shape childrenâ€™s values, then they will focus more on what their children are becoming as human beings, rather than just their exam results or promotion to the next class.
rows.outro_text: ðŸ’¡ Childrenâ€™s needs at school are many and some of them can be fulfilled without financial input. Childrenâ€™s school needs vary depending on the level of education. Older children tend to have a wider range of needs and may drop out of school if not supported well by their parents.
rows.title: Tips

rows.intro_text: State your own views firmly, and if possible clarify on how you feel about the issue:
rows.text_1:
* Try not to blame your partner or list their mistakes. 
* Try to have a neutral tone. Do not be angry. 
* Try to use â€˜Iâ€™ other than â€˜youâ€™ in your statements to help avoid blaming your partner.
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ Have a â€˜problem-solving approachâ€™. Do not try to win the argument with your partner, but try to find a solution you can both agree on. Try to do at least three positive things to improve/reinforce your relationship every time an issue of disagreement arises"
rows.title: Tips
Positive spousal relationship
rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ Positive spousal relationship is very important because taking care of children requires support from each other. It is a mixture of hard work and love, in which the relationship between parents is very important.
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ Parents should stay collaborative and have open communication to discuss how they can share parenting roles.
rows.text_3: ðŸ’¡ Always try to present a united front to the children and resolve differences away from them.
rows.text_4: ðŸ’¡ Agree on a parenting plan that you both believe is in the best interest of your children, marriage and family.

rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ Be reminded that children are gifts to us and a blessing, just like when you received the glass. Do you think, you have done your role to care, nurture, and provide enough information to your children?
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ You need to protect, care and provide information so that your child/ren are not destroyed and their dreams altered.
rows.text_3: ðŸ’¡ We can do this by giving children wise counsel, supporting them when they report risk, showing them that no one loves them more than we do, not being abusive to them.
rows.text_4: ðŸ’¡ As parents of such children, we need to encourage and support them to overcome this challenge
rows.title: Tips

rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ Finding a friendship is difficult and you might need to support your children, especially teenagers and adolescents.
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ Children need to appreciate that friends might not always agree or have the same opinion but it's important to listen to each other, be fair, and learn how to deal with issues calmly.
rows.text_3: ðŸ’¡ Teach them how to treat friends: Need to learn not to put friends down and to try and stand up for them and its needed. Friendship is given time.
rows.text_4: ðŸ’¡ Children need to learn to accept and respect each other within their friendship and as well give each other time.
rows.title: Tips

rows.intro_text: Tips to improve communication and Openness
rows.title_1: Make your spouseâ€™s happiness your priority:
rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ Your partners may not meet every need we have, but total commitment to the relationship is sufficient. Relationships are grown and with your 100% commitment hard work and sacrifice you will enjoy the relationship.
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ Marriage is not about you, but about your spouse. Share your feelings and allow someone to give you an alternative as you exercise active listening.
rows.title_3: Reduce the angle of inclination and get closer
rows.text_3: ðŸ’¡ Lean towards your spouse and form an arch that is fused together at the apex, rather than being 2 pillars standing independently and parallel next to each other.
rows.text_4: ðŸ’¡ Disregard the concerns of other people including relatives and friends and pay attention to your spouseâ€™s needs.
rows.text_5: ðŸ’¡ Build each other. Men often marry what (the beauty) they see, and are not ready for what their wives become â€“ e.g. political, professional â€“ and while women marry the potential they see in a man to be a good lover, husband and father.
rows.title: Tips
Take away
rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ Keeping many secrets/hiding issues from the people we live with, especially our spouses creates tension in the family.
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ Although sometimes it is better to keep hidden things hidden, it is often easier to live and work with someone who does not hide too much.

rows.title: The Head of Family
rows.intro_text:
In this activity we are going to: 
* Reinforce our commitment to positive, more equitable, and respectful parenting.
rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ Parenthood is not a position but a responsibility, it is not a name but a function to protect, re-assure and refill emptiness, cultivate and be a source of blessing to children and spouses.
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ Head means being a leader â€“being at the forefront and providing direction. Therefore, fathers especially, should learn from this activity and play their leadership role sufficiently.
rows.text_3: ðŸ’¡ Parents, especially fathers, strengthen their children's competence. They form lifelong healthy attitudes towards work, along with serious habits of work. Without such leadership, children would have trouble grasping the connection between effort and results, standards and achievement.
rows.text_4: ðŸ’¡ Parents teach respect for rightful authority. Being smart and far-sighted, parents know that when children fail to respect them, they may later clash with other forms of rightful authority e.g. teachers, employers, the law, God's law, and their own conscience.
rows.text_5: ðŸ’¡ Parents build healthy self-confidence in children.

rows.title: Parent's Web
rows.intro_text: Our objective is to reflect on the participantsâ€™ experience of the programme.
rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ If you wish to share your experiences with the community, you should do so willingly as it will be the best way to influence other parents in their community.
rows.text_2: ðŸ’¡ Encourage continuity of community radio programmes, community talks with schools and other meetings so that community members can raise their children respectfully.
rows.outro_text: ðŸ’¡ Thank you for your participation and openness.

rows.title: Our Group in Future
rows.intro_text: We encourage continued meetings after the formal closing of the programme
rows.text_1: ðŸ’¡ Continued meeting and providing support to one another will help you to fulfill your commitment to the group and serve as a source of emotional support.
